column4: is it possible to change the permission to 755 on a multiple files at once
type out over 100 filenames in the terminal?
you can glob them if you want, do you know about globbing?
no, but I think that is what I need, you mean group them somehow

yes, * means "anything here except a . at the beginning", so for example to get all files, you use "*" and to get all files taht start with "a" you use "a*".  google for globbing, you should get some more details
I would like to isolate just the ones I actually needed to change, I've used that option once and actually purged apps I needed :)
you use the appropriate glob pattern then
something like sudo aptitude purge php5*
yes, just an example of how I used the technique before, wasn't aware of the technical term
sweet, just what I need.........new user
